description: "The Correctional Service Canada has a requirement to enhance support and services, if necessary, to high-risk sex offenders in order to help meet two specific corporate objectives: the safe management of eligible offenders during their transition from the institution to the community, and while under supervision; and, in the case of Indigenous offenders, effective, culturally appropriate interventions and reintegration support for First Nations, Metis and Inuit offenders. The work will involve enhancing support services for high-risk sex offenders that may include recruitment, training and supervision of volunteers, the creation and operation of circle of support and accountability (COSA) model, and deliverance of support services to offenders through volunteer advocates."

### Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
#### Public Procurement Notice for Circles of Support and Accountability (COSA) Services
_____________________________________________________________________
**Contract Title:** Circles of Support and Accountability (COSA) - Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01029873  
**Solicitation Number:** 21895-23-0033  
**Publication Date:** 2023-03-13  
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-03-28T17:00:00  

**Contracting Entity:** Correctional Service of Canada  
**End User Entity:** Correctional Service of Canada

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) intends to award a contract for the provision of Circles of Support and Accountability (COSA) services to a pre-identified supplier.

**Service Requirements:**

The CSC requires a contract for the delivery of COSA services to federally supervised sex offenders on conditional or statutory release, or on Long Term Supervision Orders, in the Pacific Region. The contractor must create and operate up to fifteen (15) circles at any given time, with a minimum of four (4) contacts per month with each offender or their support network.

**Service Provider Requirements:**

The contractor must have at least two (2) years of experience, within the last five (5) years, in providing services in the following areas:

*   Working in the criminal justice system
*   Providing reintegration and support services for high-risk sex offenders
*   Recruiting, training, and supervising a volunteer base

The contractor will be responsible for recruiting, screening, and identifying core members for the COSA program, as well as delivering the COSA program and its related activities. The contractor must meet the minimum essential requirements outlined in this ACAN and must be able to demonstrate their ability to meet the required performance standards.

**Contract Details:**

The contract period is expected to be 12 months from April 1, 2023 to March 31, 2024. The estimated contract value, including options, is $60,000.00 (GST included).

**Evaluation Criteria:**

The evaluation criteria for the statement of capabilities will be based on the minimum essential requirements outlined in this ACAN.

**Statement of Capabilities:**

Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the COSA services may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified in this notice, on or before the closing date and time
